intro: Pseudopeponidium ankaranense, commonly known as the Ankaranese nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant produces small, purple berries that are typically harvested when ripe. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers are white with yellow stamens. Pseudopeponidium ankaranense is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils.
